 " It is with great pride and pleasure that I announce the completion of the Berger Bullets Reloading Manual. This 829 page manual has become real and is now available. The GT27 is an original design by them from the 1960s. Importation was stopped byt the 1968 Gun Control Act, because it was simply too small to be imported. We lost a bunch of great little guns because of that provision. Unlike many gunmakers, Tanfoglio was smart. They got a US company tk make the frames in their tooling, and then imported the rest of the parts. This made it legal in the US. 

This particular gun is one of the early high quality run that was made in the 1970s. It can be carried safely fully loaded with a round in the chamber, unlike most striker fired pocket pistols. It has been dead reliable, and is very accurate in part because it has a fixed barrel. Like many of my pocket pistols, it is fully capable of hitting spent shotgun shells at 10-20 yards. I regularly do this with many of them, including this one. I have three of these because I liked them so well that I got one for my wife. I should have asked her, because it turned out she wanted a revolver so that is what she now has. I have NEVER had a jam or misfire with it. The .25 ACP cartridge was designed by Jihn Browning to be mkre reliable than a .22 in thks size pistol. Everyone agrees that he was successful. The power is certainly not on par with a ,45 Auto, but nobody I know wants to get shot with a .25 either, lol.

This would make a great concealed carry gun, or just use it like I use my others as a fun little plinking gun or one for the tackle box. Lol, it will fit in a spinner bait tray!
